hr.h3: Neighborhood House will be closed from Monday, March 16, 2020 until at least Monday, May 4, 2020
hr.p: Please check back regularly for updates and additional resource informaiton. On this page you will find academic work assigned to NHCS students during the closure, food distribution plans, and community resources.

Our building may be closed, but school is still in session. Students are being assigned academic work to complete during this closure period. Students are responsible for completing this work. Please read our Confidentiality & Privacy Policy, and if you accept, ACCESS GOOGLE CLASSROOM HERE.
Student Guides for Distance Learning: Students and parents can refer to these guides to lean how to use Google Classroom, Zoom and Google Drive.
School assignments for K1-7th grade are linked below.

In the event of school closure due to COVID-19, school assignments will be distributed to 8th-11th Grade students via google classrooms. If your child does not have access to technology from which to access google classrooms at home (a smart phone, tablet, or computer) please let their advisor or Ms. Harrison know. Please read our Confidentiality & Privacy Policy, and if you accept, ACCESS GOOGLE CLASSROOM HERE

td.br:

hr.p: NEW DAYS/HOURS STARTING MONDAY, MARCH 30: Starting on Monday, March 30th and continuing until further notice, we will be providing grab-and-go meals (breakfast and lunch) on Mondays and Thursdays ONLY between 3 – 6pm at our Centre Street Campus.

ul.li: Please note, we have chosen this location because it is more easily accessible by T than our Queen Street Campus, but meals will be provided for any student in Boston grades K1 – 12. Students do not need to be enrolled at NHCS to be eligible. No child will be turned away.

Meals will be available for pick-up from Legends Hall. This is the door normally used to enter the building before 8:30 am. It is located on the east-facing side of the building. We will have signs directing you to the location.
Do not use the main entrance to the building at 197 Centre Street as that door will not be attended.

If you are unfamiliar with our Centre Street Campus:
By car: please use 18 Samoset Street, Dorchester MA 02124 for your GPS, which will take you to the parking lot.
By T: the building is a short two-block walk from the Shawmut station on the Red Line.
We recommend bringing a reusable bag to transport meals.

hr.p: Additional food site locations in Boston are also available for ALL Boston students grades K1-12. Boston Public Schools will continue to provide free breakfast and lunch meals to all Boston students. This includes community based early childhood provider students, charters, Metco, and Catholic parochial schools. BPS will distribute the meals at several dozen locations throughout the City of Boston beginning on Tuesday, March 17. A variety of packaged meal options will be available for pick-up Monday – Friday from 8:30 am – 11:30 am. Visit www.bostonpublicschools.org/coronavirus for the full list. No child will be turned away.

Additionally, the City of Boston in partnership with Project Bread, YMCA of Greater Boston, Boston Centers for Youth and Families, and other community organizations will also be providing free meals to school-aged children at various locations and times across the city. Click here to view all the current meal locations and times. More locations will become available over the coming week.

The City of Boston has created pick up sites available throughout the city for families to access food. This is similar to the plan used during summer recess. You may review the map of available sites and share with families that you know may be in greatest need. This information will be sent out to all families.

p.strong: Click here for an interactive map of all Boston Public Schools Distribution Sites.

hr.p: We have compiled information about resources available to members of the Boston community. We will continue to update this information as we learn of new opportunities or resources. If you have questions about any of the resources listed below, or if you’d like to add new resources to the list, please contact Tanisha Cooper, NHCS’s Family Engagement Coordinator and Homeless Education Liaison: tcooper@thenhc.org

br.a:
NOTICE TO STAFF ANAD FAMILIES:
Families First Coronavirus Response Act
